body_html:
I'm curious, is random delay better than the fixed delay that was
implemented in #4501? The
random sub-second sleep seems to be adding a particular complexity to the
retry logic, I wonder if this is justified and what the expected wins are.

On Sat, Sep 24, 2016 at 6:43 PM, Balachander Ramachandran <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

@davidj-github https://github.com/davidj-github @rinugun
https://github.com/rinugun @prb12 https://github.com/prb12 what do
you guys think?

—

body:
I'm curious, is random delay better than the fixed delay that was
implemented in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/4501? The
random sub-second sleep seems to be adding a particular complexity to the
retry logic, I wonder if this is justified and what the expected wins are.

On Sat, Sep 24, 2016 at 6:43 PM, Balachander Ramachandran <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @davidj-github https://github.com/davidj-github @rinugun
> https://github.com/rinugun @prb12 https://github.com/prb12 what do
> you guys think?
>
